item.description:
@Wank wrote:

[quote=“AtomicInt_, post:37, topic:420058”][quote author=sssylasss link=topic=550168.msg4032865#msg4032865 date=1340931904]

Maybe try doing it with xml, cuz this is a fuckload of code lol,

XML is not good, the overhead with XML loading is ridiculous.
[/quote]

No, you’re wrong, it is so much easier to load via XML.

Maybe try doing it with xml, cuz this is a fuckload of code lol,

Why would you use XML when you could load NPC’s and global objects through a perfectly fine SQL database.

I don’t even think that would be necessary, I would load NPCs, Objects, Dialogues, Item Definitions, etc. through XML loaded via the server on start up, the only thing I would use SQL for would be loading and saving players.[/quote]

I can see where you’re coming from :p. Each to his own I suppose.

Read full topic

item.title: Complete Sorted Tutorial List [Updated October 30th, 2011]
item.dc:creator: @i_am_infamy i am infamy
item.description:
@i_am_infamy wrote:

Basically this is for all the leechers who need the NPC’s Worldwide on there server this is about 90% of npcs’ and i will keep updating this tutorial when i add more npcs to my server.

So lets get started go into your spawn-config.cfg folder and replace yours with mine

http://pastebin.com/LV8i9m0M

By now you have 90% of runescape’s npc’s Enjoy that now ima teach you how to keep it organized and how to add more npc’s.

So basically everything is organized on my Spawn-config file
search the city you are about to add your npc’s in, in the spawn config and under that add this

eg.

[size=12pt]spawn = 3340 1780 5190 0 1 32 300 200 Giant mole

The 3340 is the npc id

the 1780 is the x coord and 5190 is the y cord

the 0 is the height

the 1 is if your npc moves around or not

the 32 is the max hit

the 300 is the attack

and 200 is the defence.
[/size]
Everything can be changed to your liking’s Enjoy

Read full topic
